comment_text: The proposed amendments to corporate governance are excellent and will significantly enhance transparency and accountability. This is a much-needed reform that will boost investor confidence.
I strongly oppose the implementation timeline. Small and medium enterprises need at least 18 months to comply with these stringent requirements. The current 6-month timeline is unrealistic.
The requirement for independent directors is well thought out. However, the qualification criteria should be more clearly defined to avoid ambiguity in implementation.
This legislation will impose significant compliance costs on businesses. We estimate an additional burden of 2-3% of annual revenue for small companies. This is unsustainable.
Excellent initiative! The whistleblower protection mechanisms are particularly important and will help combat corporate fraud effectively.
The penalty structure seems disproportionately harsh for minor violations. There should be a graded approach based on the severity and intent of non-compliance.
We need clarification on what constitutes 'material information' in the context of disclosure requirements. The current definition is too vague.
The audit committee requirements are aligned with international best practices. This will enhance the credibility of Indian companies in global markets.
Concerned about the overlap with existing regulations. This creates confusion and increases compliance burden without adding value.
The provision for digital reporting is forward-thinking and will streamline the compliance process. However, ensure adequate cybersecurity measures.
Small businesses will struggle to meet these requirements. Consider a phased implementation based on company size and turnover.
The focus on ESG reporting is commendable and timely. This will help companies align with global sustainability standards.
The definition of 'related party transactions' needs to be more comprehensive to prevent loopholes that could be exploited.
Strongly support the mandatory rotation of auditors. This will enhance audit independence and quality.
The compliance costs are prohibitive for startups. There should be exemptions or relaxed norms for companies below a certain threshold.
The requirement for quarterly compliance certificates will create unnecessary paperwork. Annual certification should be sufficient.
Excellent provisions for minority shareholder protection. This will strengthen corporate democracy and fairness.
The technology requirements for real-time reporting are too advanced for many companies. Provide a transition period of 2 years.
The board diversity requirements are progressive and will bring fresh perspectives to corporate decision-making.
Need more clarity on the implementation mechanism and regulatory oversight. Who will monitor compliance and how?
